cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with secret sharing schemes, which are commonly used in cryptography and information theory. The paper discusses the amount of communication required to decode a secret in a threshold secret sharing scheme, which is a topic that falls under the category of cryptography (cs.CR) and information theory (cs.IT). The paper also mentions the use of secret sharing schemes in distributed storage, which falls under the category of distributed computing (cs.DC) and distributed systems (cs.DS). Finally, the paper discusses the construction of secret sharing schemes, which is a topic in theoretical computer science (cs.CC).
